Dating: 18TH DYNASTY (not before); AMENHOTEP III/AMENOPHIS III/NEBMAATRE ?; 18TH DYNASTY (not after)
Name: Stela
Description: In the lunette are two symmetrical udjat-eyes, a shen-ring, a bowl and three water lines. Underneath is a man shown seated on a chair and holding a lotus flower to his nose. In front of him is an offering table in the shape of a large lotus flower. The woman on the right is pouring a liquid over the offering table.The left-hand third of the lower register is empty, the remainder depicts two children. On the left is a boy with a folding stool in his right hand. Behind him is a girl holding two lotus buds to her nose.There are no inscriptions with the scenes.
